Acts, Ordinances, President ’s Orders and Regulations

Gilgit , the 3rd December , 201 9 
 
THE GILGIT -BALTISTAN ( INDUCTION/REGULATIRZATION OF SAP 
SCHOOL TEACHERS) ACT, 2019  
(ACT NO.IX OF 2019)  
 
ALA -1(1)/2019/GBLA. —To provide for the induction /appointment of 
the teachers appointed in Social Action Program (SAP) under the Northern Areas 
Education Project who are curre ntly serving under the administrative control of 
National Education Foundation, Ministry of Federal Education, Islamabad 
subject to transfer of their services along with the assets and Endowment Fund 
from National Education Foundation, Ministry of Federal Education, Islamabad 
to Education Department, Gilgit -Baltistan.  
 
Preamble .—Whereas it is expedient to provide for induction/  
appointment of the teachers appointed in Social Action Program (SAP) under the 
Northern Areas Education project who are currently s erving under the 
administrative control of National Education Foundation, Ministry of Federal 
Education, Islamabad subject to transfer of their services alongiwth the assets and 
Endowment Fund from National Education Foundation Ministry of Federal 
Educatio n, Islamabad to Education Department, Gilgit -Baltistan.  
 
(795) 
 
Price: Rs. 10.0 0 
[2068(2019 )/Ex. Gaz.]   
796 THE  GAZETTE  OF PAKISTAN,  EXTRA.,   DECEMBER  31, 2019  [PART I 
 
 
 It is hereby enacted as follows: — 
 
 1. Short title and commencement .— (1) This act may be called the 
Gilgit -Baltistan (Induction /Appointment of SAP Scho ol Teachers) Act, 2019.  
 
2. Definitions .— (1) In this Ac t, unless the context otherwise requires,  
 
 (a) “Government ” means the Government of Gilgit -Baltistan;  
 
(b) “SAP School ” means the existing school buildings constructed 
under the Northern Areas Educat ion Project with the aid of World 
Bank and /or by the community and are under the administrative 
control of National Education Foundation, Ministry of Education, 
Islamabad;  
 
(c) “SAP School Teacher ” means a teacher working in a SAP School;  
 
(d) “Department ” means the Education Department of Government of 
Gilgit -Baltistan;  
 
(e) “Hard Areas ” means Hard Areas already notified by Education 
Department, Gilgit -Baltistan for appointment of teachers;  
 
(f) “Departmental Selection Committee ” means a Departmental 
Selection Committee constituted for making selection for initial 
appointment through walk -in-interviews in Education Department, 
Gilgit -Baltistan;  
 
(g) “Employee ” means those duly qualified persons who were 
appointed as Teacher in the SAP School under the Nor thern Areas 
Education Project and are currently serving as SAP School Teacher 
in the SAP School under the administrative control of National 
Education Foundation, Ministry of Federal Education, Islamabad;  
 
(h) “Law or rules”  means the law or rules for the time being enforced 
governing the selection, appointment and induction of SAP School 
Teachers in Education Department, Gilgit -Baltistan;  
 
(i) “Post”  means a post of Matric Trained Teacher (BS -09) created in 
Education Department, Gilgit -Baltistan for induct ion of SAP 
School Teachers.  
 
(2) All other terms shall have the same meaning as respectively 
assigned to them in the Gilgit -Baltistan Civil Servants Act, 2011.  
 
PART  I]        THE  GAZETTE  OF PAKISTAN,  EXTRA.,  DECEMBER 31 , 2019 797 
 
 
  3. Induction of SAP School Teachers .—(1) Notwithstanding 
anything contained in any other law o r rules, the employees appointed and 
currently serving in SAP Schools shall be deemed to have validly appointed on 
regular basis from the day of commencement of this Act:  
 
 Provided that;  
 
i. SAP School Teachers who were appointed in the schools 
constructe d by the community under Northern Areas Education 
Project (NAEP) with support of World Bank and technical 
assistance /supervision of Education Department Gilgit -Baltistan, 
and are currently serving shall be inducted in Education 
Department, Gilgit -Baltista n against 750 created posts of M.T 
Teachers (BS -09) as per procedure with approval of competent 
authority. Only the employees appointed in SAP School Buildings 
constructed by the Northern Areas Education Project (NAEP) shall 
be considered excluding Non -Formal Teacher Working in the SAP 
Schools and remaining SAP/BECS School Teachers will be 
considered if any post remains vacant out of 750 po sts and on 
creation of additional post of M.T Teachers (BS -09). 
 
ii. The Department shall have the sole responsibilitie s /authority for 
distortion of posts in District based on the actual strength of 
teachers and existence of SAP Schools.  
 
iii. Induction of SAP Schools Teachers shall be made on Tehsil level 
(for both male and female) except in Hard Areas where induction 
shall be made on Hard Area basis. However further posting/transfer 
of the teaches shall be made as per policy of the department. The 
production of domicile by the SAP teacher shall be mandatory.  
 
iv. For induction of SAP School Teacher the minimum enrollment  
required in a SAP School shall not be less than 20 students. The 
requirement of minimum enrollment shall be relaxed to 15 students 
per school in Hard Areas.  
 
v. The maximum age limit for induction of a SAP School Teacher in 
Education Department, Gilgit -Baltistan shall be 50 years as on 
commencement of this Act.  
 
vi. The Teachers who are overaged i.e., above 50 years of age as on 
commencement of this act shall be granted lump sum payment of 
Rs. 0.6 Million and their services shall stand concluded /terminate d 
thereafter.  
 
vii. Minimum qualified required Matriculation.  
798 THE  GAZETTE  OF PAKISTAN,  EXTRA.,   DECEMBER  31, 2019  [PART I 
 
 
 viii. The Education Department, Gilgit -Baltistan shall prepare and 
maintain a merit list/seniority list of the already serving SAP 
School Teachers on the basis of continuous length of services 
(without any break) and if two or more teachers have same length 
of services, the teacher older in age shall be deemed senior.  
 
ix. The following committees shall have mandate for induction of SAP 
School Teachers against the created posts in the department and for 
transfer of Assets and Endowment Funds from National Education 
Foundation, Ministry of Federal Education, and Islamabad: - 
 
(a) Committees under the chairmanship of the Divisional 
Directors Education having the representatives of the Services 
and Fi nance Department as members shall be notified by the 
Department for induction of SAP School Teacher in the 
department.  
 
(b) A Complaints Redressal Committee headed by the Director 
General Education (Schools), Gilgit -Baltistan with 
representation of Deputy Secretaries of Services, Finance and 
Law Department as members shall also be notified by the 
department.  
 
(c) To take over the Assets of SAP School and endowment fund 
lent to National Education Foundation, Ministry of Federal 
Education by the Government an d for mutation/transfer of all 
SAP School buildings in the name of Education Department 
Gilgit -Baltistan, the following Committee shall be notified: - 
 
Committee for Transfer of Buildings /Land and other infrastructure  
 
1. Deputy Director Education of relev ant district.  Chairman  
 
2. Representative of District Administration . Member  
 
3. Representative of National Education Foundation,  
 Gilgit -Baltistan.  Member  
 
4. Representative of Area /Village Education Committee.  Member  
  
Committee for Transfer of Endowm ent Fund  
 
1. Director General Education (School), GB . Member  
 
2. Deputy Secretary Finance Department (Dev).  Member

 3. Deputy Se cretary (Development) Education.  
 Department Gilgit -Baltistan.  Member  
 
4. Director National Education Foundation, Gilgit -Baltista n. Member  
 
x. The orders for induction/regularization of SAP School Teachers 
shall only be issued after transfer of assets/building to E ducation 
Department, Government  of Gilgit -Baltistan.  
 
 4. Determination of Seniority .— (1) The employees who are 
induct ed against the posts in Education Department under this Act or in the 
process of attaining service at the commencement of this Act shall rank junior to 
a Civil Servant belonging to same service or cadre, as the case may be, who are 
in service on regular ba sis on the commencement of this Act, and shall also rank 
junior to such other persons, if any, who, in pursuance of their recommendations 
of the Committee made before the commencement of this Act, or to be appointed 
to the respective service or cadre, irre spective of the actual date of appointment.  
 
 (2). The seniority interest of the employee , who are inducted under 
this Act, within the same service or cadre, shall be determined on the basis of 
their continuous offic iating in such service or cadre:  
 
 Provi ded that if the date of continuous officiating in the case of two or 
more employees in the same cadre, the employee older in age shall rank senior to 
the younger one.  
 
 5. Removal of difficulties. — if any difficulty arises in giving effect 
to any of the pr ovision of this Act, the Department may give such direction as it 
may consider necessary for the removal of such difficulty.  
 
 6. Overriding effect. —Notwithstanding anything to the contrary 
contained in any other law or rules, the provision of this Act sha ll have an 
overriding effect and the provisions of any such law or rules to the extent of 
inconsistency to this Act shall cease to have effect.  
  
 
FIDA MUHAMMAD NASHAD , 
Speaker . 
Gilgit -Baltistan Assembly .
